<h3 id="make-a-decision-and-state-the-conclusion-3"><strong>5. Make a Decision and State the Conclusion</strong></h3>
<p><strong>Decision Rule:</strong> Reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> if the calculated test statistic (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.61508em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span></span></span></span></span>) is greater than the critical value (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t_{\alpha, df}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.901188em; vertical-align: -0.286108em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.336108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mpunct mtight">,</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.10764em;">df</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.286108em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>).</p>

<p><strong>New Section: Decision Based on Hypothesis Test</strong></p>
<h2 id="based-on-the-results-of-the-hypothesis-test-2">Based on the results of the hypothesis test:</h2>
<p>We <strong>Fail to reject</strong> the null hypothesis.</p>
<hr>
<p><strong>Understanding the Decision Options in Hypothesis Testing</strong></p>
<p>When performing a hypothesis test, after calculating the test statistic and comparing it to the critical value (or comparing the p-value to the significance level), you arrive at one of two primary conclusions regarding your null hypothesis (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>Reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Meaning:</strong> This means that the observed sample data is sufficiently different from what would be expected if the null hypothesis were true, to a degree that is statistically significant.</li>
<li><strong>Implication:</strong> There is enough statistical evidence to support the alternative hypothesis (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>). You are concluding that the effect or difference you are testing for is likely real and not just due to random chance.</li>
<li><strong>Analogy:</strong> Similar to a “guilty” verdict in a court of law. There is enough evidence to conclude guilt beyond a reasonable doubt.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Fail to reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Meaning:</strong> This means that the observed sample data is <em>not</em> sufficiently different from what would be expected if the null hypothesis were true. The difference observed, if any, could reasonably be attributed to random chance.</li>
<li><strong>Implication:</strong> There is <em>not</em> enough statistical evidence to support the alternative hypothesis (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>). It does <strong>not</strong> mean that the null hypothesis is true, but simply that the current data does not provide compelling grounds to discard it.</li>
<li><strong>Analogy:</strong> Similar to a “not guilty” verdict in a court of law. There wasn’t enough evidence to prove guilt, but it doesn’t necessarily mean the person is innocent.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Unable to decide:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Meaning:</strong> This is generally <strong>not a valid outcome</strong> in a properly executed hypothesis test. A well-designed statistical test, using a predefined significance level, will always lead to either a decision to “reject” or “fail to reject” the null hypothesis.</li>
<li><strong>Implication:</strong> If one feels “unable to decide,” it often indicates an issue with the data quality, sample size (too small to detect a real effect), incorrect test application, or a misunderstanding of the hypothesis testing framework. It is not a statistical conclusion.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>

<h3 id="determine-the-critical-value-4"><strong>6. Determine the Critical Value</strong></h3>
<p>For a right-tailed z-test with <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha = 0.05</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.05</span></span></span></span></span>:</p>
<p>We need to find <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>z</mi><mi>α</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>z</mi><mn>0.05</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">z_{\alpha} = z_{0.05}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.58056em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.04398em;">z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.151392em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.04398em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0.05</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>. This is the z-score that leaves 5% of the area in the right tail of the standard normal distribution (or 95% of the area to its left).</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Using a standard normal (Z) table or calculator:</strong><br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>z</mi><mn>0.05</mn></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.645</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">z_{0.05} \approx 1.645</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.63312em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.04398em;">z</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.04398em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0.05</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≈</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.645</span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Wolfram Alpha Input:</strong> <code>InverseCDF[NormalDistribution[0, 1], 0.95]</code><br>
Result: <code>1.64485...</code></p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="calculate-the-p-value-1"><strong>7. Calculate the P-value</strong></h3>
<p>For a right-tailed test, the p-value is the probability of observing a z-statistic as extreme as, or more extreme than, the calculated z-statistic, assuming the null hypothesis is true.</p>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo>&gt;</mo><mn>1.7145</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{Z} &gt; 1.7145)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Z</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">1.7145</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Using a standard normal (Z) table or calculator:</strong><br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo>&gt;</mo><mn>1.7145</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo>≤</mo><mn>1.7145</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≈</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.9569</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.0431</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(\text{Z} &gt; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Z</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Z</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≤</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">1.7145</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≈</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.72777em; vertical-align: -0.08333em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.222222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; <h3 id="make-a-decision-and-state-the-conclusion-4"><strong>8. Make a Decision and State the Conclusion</strong></h3>
<p><strong>Decision Rule:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Using Critical Value:</strong> Reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> if Test Statistic &gt; Critical Value.<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.7145</mn><mo>&gt;</mo><mn>1.645</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.7145 &gt; 1.645</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.68354em; vertical-align: -0.0391em;"></span><span class="mord">1.7145</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">&gt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.645</span></span></span></span></span>. Since the test statistic is greater than the critical value, we reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Using P-value:</strong> Reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> if P-value <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\le \alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.77194em; vertical-align: -0.13597em;"></span><span class="mrel">≤</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span></span>.<br>
<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.0431</mn><mo>≤</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.0431 \le 0.05</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.78041em; vertical-align: -0.13597em;"></span><span class="mord">0.0431</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≤</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.277778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.05</span></span></span></span></span>. Since the p-value is less than or equal to the significance level, we reject <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.301108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.08125em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="✅-final-answer-for-the-two-proportion-problem-1">✅ <strong>Final Answer (for the two proportion problem):</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>The test statistic is:</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.71</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.71</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.71</span></span></span></span></span> (rounded to two decimal places)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>The critical value is:</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.65</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.65</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.65</span></span></span></span></span> (rounded to two decimal places)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>The p-value is:</strong> <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.043</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.043</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.043</span></span></span></span></span> (rounded to three decimal places)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Based on the above we:</strong> <strong>Reject</strong> the null hypothesis.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr>
<p><strong>New Section: Paired t-Test for Drug Efficacy (Weight Loss)</strong></p>

<h3 id="concept-9"><strong>Concept</strong></h3>
<p>This problem involves testing if a drug has an effect on weight. Since we have “before” and “after” measurements for the <em>same</em> patients, this is a <strong>paired samples t-test</strong>. We are looking for <em>any</em> effect (negative or positive), so it will be a two-tailed test.</p>

<h3 id="determine-the-critical-value-5"><strong>4. Determine the Critical Value</strong></h3>
<p>For a two-tailed t-test:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Significance Level (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span></span>): <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.01</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.01</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">0.01</span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p><strong>New Section: 99% Two-Sided Confidence Interval for Paired Difference (Weight Loss)</strong></p>
<h2 id="construct-a-99-two-sided-confidence-interval-for-the-difference-in-weight.">Construct a 99% two-sided confidence interval for the difference in weight.</h2>
<h3 id="concept-10"><strong>Concept</strong></h3>
<p>To construct a two-sided confidence interval for the mean difference (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mu_D</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.19444em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">μ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.328331em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">D</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>) in a paired t-test, we use the formula:</p>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>d</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>α</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>d</mi></msub><msqrt><mi>n</mi></msqrt></mfrac><mo separator="true">,</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mover accent="true"><mi>d</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>α</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>d</mi></msub><msqrt><mi>n</mi></msqrt></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">[\bar{d} - t_{\alpha/2, n-1} \cdot \frac{s_d}{\sqrt{n}}, \quad \bar{d} + t_{\alpha/2, n-1} \cdot \frac{s_d}{\sqrt{n}}]</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.08122em; <p>Where:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>d</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\bar{d}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83122em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.83122em;"><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.26344em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.08333em;"><span class="mord">ˉ</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the mean of the differences.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>d</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">s_d</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.58056em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">s</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.336108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">d</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the standard deviation of the differences.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span> is the number of pairs (sample size).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mi>α</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>2</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t_{\alpha/2, n-1}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.97028em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mord mtight">/2</span><span class="mpunct mtight">,</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span><span class="mbin mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3552em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the critical t-value for a two-tailed interval with significance level <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span></span> and <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n-1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.66666em; </li>
</ul>
<h3 id="retrieve-givencalculated-information-1"><strong>1. Retrieve Given/Calculated Information</strong></h3>
<p>From the previous paired t-test calculations:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Mean of Differences (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>d</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\bar{d}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.83122em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.83122em;"><span class="" style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span></span><span class="" style="top: -3.26344em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.08333em;"><span class="mord">ˉ</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>): <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>2.225</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">2.225</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">2.225</span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Sample Standard Deviation of Differences (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>d</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">s_d</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.58056em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">s</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.336108em;"><span class="" style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">d</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span class=""></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>): <span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.05609</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.05609</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.64444em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord">1.05609</span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Sample Size (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.43056em; vertical-align: 0em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span>): 16</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Degrees of Freedom (<span class="katex--inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">df = n-1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.88888em; <h3 id="find-the-critical-t-value-t_alpha2-n-1-1"><strong>2. This is the same critical value determined in the previous hypothesis test.</p>
<ul>
<li>

<h2 id="assume-they-now-want-to-set-up-a-test-to-support-the-claim-that-the-drug-has-had-a-positive-effect-i.e.-has-led-to-weight-loss.-how-should-the-hypotheses-of-such-a-test-look">Assume they now want to set up a test to support the claim that the drug has had a positive effect, i.e. has led to weight loss. <h3 id="concept-11"><strong>Concept</strong></h3>
<p>This is a follow-up hypothesis testing problem for the same paired data, but with a different claim. Now, the manufacturer wants to support the claim that the drug has had a <em>positive effect</em>, specifically meaning weight <em>loss</em>.</p>
